meanings.definition: A space or area that is completely filled with matter
meanings.sent1: The attic was a plenums of old furniture and boxes.
meanings.sent2: The fish tank was a plenums of colorful stones and plants.
meanings.sent3: The garage was so full, it became a plenums of tools and equipment.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a plenums of creative ideas waiting to burst out.
meanings.sent5: The storage room was a plenums of forgotten treasures waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: A condition in which all the members of a group are present
meanings.sent1: The family reunion was a plenums with relatives from near and far.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was a plenums with eager students ready to learn.
meanings.sent3: The party became a plenums of laughter and joy as friends gathered.
meanings.sent4: The team meeting was a plenums of diverse opinions and perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The concert hall was a plenums of music lovers enjoying the performance.
